intro: Hieracium sepositum, commonly known as the clustered hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are rough and hairy, with a basal rosette structure, and it produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium sepositum is often found in open habitats and can spread through its rhizomatous growth system.
